content.question: Based on the data in Table 1, which of the following best describes the relationship between the <math alttext="M C l R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi><mi>C</mi><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mn>1</mn></mstyle><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> gene and coat color in the Carrizozo, New Mexico, rock pocket mouse population?

choices.label: The <math alttext="M C l R D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi><mi>C</mi><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mn>1</mn></mstyle><mi>R</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>D</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> allele is responsible for dark coat color in the Carrizozo population and likely spread from the Arizona population through migration.

The <math alttext="M C l R D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi><mi>C</mi><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mn>1</mn></mstyle><mi>R</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>D</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> allele is not responsible for dark coat color in the Carrizozo population, so the dark coat color is likely a result of convergent evolution.

The <math alttext="M C l R D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi><mi>C</mi><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mn>1</mn></mstyle><mi>R</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>D</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> allele is absent from the Carrizozo population, so all the mice in this population must have coats that are light in color.

The <math alttext="M C l R D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi><mi>C</mi><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mn>1</mn></mstyle><mi>R</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>D</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> allele is absent from the Carrizozo population because of different environmental pressures in the Carrizozo population.

content.answer: The <math alttext="M C l R D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi><mi>C</mi><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mn>1</mn></mstyle><mi>R</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>D</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> allele is not responsible for dark coat color in the Carrizozo population, so the dark coat color is likely a result of convergent evolution.

skill.text: 4.B: Describe data from a table or graph, including: i. identifying specific data points ii. describing trends and patterns in the data iii. describing relationships between variables
